Package com.esri.mo2.client.aims

Implementation of the Content API for ArcIMS 4 client services.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ServerProxy Deprecated. - the interface has been deprecated, see Content API.
ServiceUser Defines an object that uses a service provided by ArcIMS
 

Class Summary
ArcIms4Connection This connection provides access to the Content found at an ArcIMS 4 web site.
ArcIms4ContentProvider Implements the ConnectionProvider interface for ArcIMS data source.
ArcIms4Source This Source provides access to the Content found in an ArcIMS 4 web site.
BaseFolderProxy BaseFolderProxy is used to obtain a folder object given a folder name and BaseEsrimap.
CookieUtil A helper utility for retrieving AXL responses from the application server regarding cookie data manipulation.
FeatureServer Deprecated. - the class has been deprecated, see Content API.
Folder The folder object represents a folder in the ArcIMS Administrator.
FolderItem A FolderItem represents the data that is to be stored in a Folder on the Application Server.
FolderItemData This class is used to create or contain a FolderItem Data Element of a Folder Item
FolderItems A utility class that manages a collection of FolderItem objects.
FolderUtil This class is used by the Folder classes as a helper.
GeoCodeExtension this is the implementation of GeoCoding for a Layer that originates from the ArcIMS server.
ImageServer Deprecated. - the class has been deprecated, see Content API.
IMSGeocoder An ArcIMS4 implementaion of the Geocoder interface.
LayerInfoImpl this class defines a LayerInfoImpl that is common to both FeatureServer and ImageServer, for all Layers produced by FeatureServer, and for all sub-Layers produced by ImageServer.
ServiceCapabilities This class defines capabilities for Services.
ServiceDetail This is a helper class that holds information about a service that is running on an ArcIMS server.
ServiceEnvironment this kind of Environment supports ServiceCapabilities
StoredQueryExtension This is the implementation of StoredQueries for a Layer that originates from the ArcIMS server.
 

Exception Summary
AIMSException A generic Exception thrown within the com.esri.mo2.client.aims package.
FolderItemAlreadyExistsException This exception is thrown by FolderItems class when an attempt to add a FolderItem is made and the FolderItem already exists.
FolderItemDoesNotExistException This exception is thrown by the FolderItems class when an attempt is made to remove a FolderItem data object that does not exist.
FolderNotFoundException This exception is thrown by the getFolder() method in BaseFolderProxy when a Folder cannot be found by the specified Folder name.
InvalidLayerInfoException Thrown within FeatureServer when a GET_SERVICE_INFO request results in invalid XML
InvalidStreamDataException Thrown when invalid data is detected within the IFS input stream
MissingFeatureIdFieldException Thrown within FeatureServer when it is detected that a FeatureClass defined as the result of a LayerInfo request has no FeatureIdField - should never happen....
MissingShapeFieldException Thrown within FeatureServer when it is detected that a FeatureClass defined as the result of a LayerInfo request has no ShapeField - should never happen....
 

Package com.esri.mo2.client.aims Description

Implementation of the Content API for ArcIMS 4 client services. Applications can connect to ArcIMS 4 objects, such as an Image service layer, Feature service layer,and a geocoder, using this implementation. A typical sequence for accessing ArcIMS 4 content is like this:

   Connection connection = new ArcIms4Connection("web site URL");
   Source source = SourceCache.getSource(connection);
   source.connect();
   Content content = source.getContent("path to content");
   source.disconnect();
Content paths have the following form for ArcIMS objects:
    /ServiceName/ContentName
For example, at the Geography Network Web site (http://www.geographynetwork.com), there is an Image service named "ESRI_World". The path to the ImageLayer there is "/ESRI_World/ESRI_World".

The simplest way to ensure that the correct path is used to access a particular content is to view the path to the content shown in the Catalog component - for instance, when used within the JoView+ sample application.

That package also contains implementations of DataSource, Workspace, and FeatureClass for communication with the ESRI ArcIMS FeatureServer.
